text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Sharayah Corcoran,
Associate Cloud Infrastructure Architect.

And I work on the AWS
Professional Services Team.

What my team does is we
work with the public sector

and we meet with clients
in order to figure out
what they might need within AWS
and help them achieve those goals.
Since I'm still fairly new,

I recently went through
the onboarding experience,
which includes earning a certification,

shadowing with customers,
and also completing a project
that you have to like build out
and perform your consulting duties
as you would in in the field.
I did have a few preconceptions

about AWS being maybe a
little too challenging

or being very potentially
difficult working environment,
but that has proven to be completely false

and I've learned that
that's a misconception
on my part to think that,

one, they're looking for
somebody to know everything,
'cause they're not, and two,

they are very good at balancing
the work life balance.

For anybody hoping to
come into the company,
I would suggest to them
that they don't second-guess themselves
and don't second-guess their knowledge.
They can definitely do it

and I would just encourage them
to try and work here anyway.
(gentle music)
